com.wizzer.mle.runtime.scheduler

Class MleScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.runtime.scheduler.MleScheduler

  • public class MleScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    The MleScheduler class is used to schedule phases of execution which might be required by a runtime engine. For example, a 3D game engine might require four phases of execution:
    1. a behavioral pass on a scene graph to update an actor's behavior
    2. a pre-render pass on a scene graph to calculate transformations
    3. a render pass on a scene graph to render a scene to an offscreen buffer
    4. a post-render pass to blit the offscreen buffer to a screen

    Each phase of the scheduler must be registered by calling addPhase with an instance of the MlePhase class. The MlePhase class is a collection of tasks which must be executed during that phase. The tasks are actually java.lang.Thread objects encapsulated by the MleTask class.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mark S. Millard
    See Also:
    MlePhase, MleTask

      • addPhase

        public boolean addPhase(MlePhase phase)
        Adds a phase to this scheduler.
        Parameters:
        phase - An instance of MlePhase.
        Returns:
        A boolean value is returned indicating whether the phase was successfully added. If the phase was successfully added, then true is returned; otherwise, false will be returned.
        See Also:
        MlePhase

      • getPhase

        public MlePhase getPhase(int n)
        Gets the phase at index n.
        Parameters:
        n - An integer identifying the nth phase in this scheduler.
        Returns:
        If a phase is found at the specifed location, n, then an object of type MlePhase will be returned. Otherwise, null will be returned.

      • addTask

        public boolean addTask(MlePhase phase,
                       MleTask task)
        Adds a task to the specified phase. The phase must have been previously registered with this scheduler.
        Parameters:
        phase - The phase which the task will be added to.
        task - The task which will be added to the specifed phase.
        Returns:
        A boolean value is returned indicating whether the task was successfully added to the specifed phase. If the task was successfully added, then true is returned; otherwise, false will be returned.
        See Also:
        MlePhase, MleTask

      • deleteTask

        public boolean deleteTask(MlePhase phase,
                          MleTask task)
        Removes the a task from the specified phase. The phase must be registered with this scheduler.
        Parameters:
        phase - The phase which the task will be removed from.
        task - The task which will be removed from the specifed phase.
        Returns:
        A boolean value is returned indicating whether the task was successfully deleted from the specifed phase. If the task was successfully deleted, then true is returned; otherwise, false will be returned.
        See Also:
        MlePhase, MleTask

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes scheduled phases. The order of execution is based on the order in which the phases were registered with this scheduler. A phase must complete before the next phase is executed. A phase is complete when all tasks registered with that phase have completed and are no longer running.

        When all phases have been processed, the execution continues again with the first phase. Thus the phases are executed using a round-robin algorithm.

        To discontinue execution, the scheduler must be flagged by specifying that it is Ok to exit. This is done using the setExitOk method. The scheduler will finish executing the current phase and exit prior to starting the next phase.

        No state is maintained between phases. Therefore an application which has discontinued execution by setting the exit Ok flag should not expect the scheduler to start up again at the next phase if this method is invoked again. run will always invalidate the exit Ok flag and start at the first scheduled phase.

      • go

        public void go(MlePhase phase)
        Run the specified phase.
        Parameters:
        phase - The phase to execute.

      • dump

        public void dump()
        Dumps the list of registered phases for this scheduler. It will also list the tasks associated with each phase.
